###Cross-Validation
####from page 190 lab from 205 

**example @ 5.1.1**
*purpose:* to check which regression function is better  
*method:* to make split the dataset into two part.   
*result:* the poly(horsepower, 2) show more lower error rate. 
__NEXT STEP: make page 178 charts --> is anyway to make a function for it. __
```{r}
library(ISLR)
set.seed(1)

summary(Auto.lm1)
train_index = sample(c(TRUE, FALSE), size = nrow(Auto), replace = TRUE, prob = c(.5, .5))


Auto.lm1 = lm(mpg ~ horsepower, data = Auto, subset = train_index)
Auto.lm1.pre = predict(Auto.lm1, Auto[!train_index, ])
test_error <- mean((Auto[!train_index, "mpg"] - Auto.lm1.pre) ^ 2)
poly_num <- 1

Auto.lm2 = lm(mpg ~ poly(horsepower, 2), data = Auto, subset = train_index)
Auto.lm2.pre = predict(Auto.lm2, Auto[!train_index, ])
test_error[length(test_error)+1] <- mean((Auto[!train_index, "mpg"] - Auto.lm2.pre)^2)
poly_num[length(poly_num)+1] <- 2


```
